description:
Google's custom-designed machines make up one of the largest and most powerful computing infrastructures in the world. The Hardware Testing Engineering team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the R&D lab, you design test equipment for prototypes of our machinery and develop the protocols used to scale these tests for the entire global team. Working closely with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality and reliability.

With your technical expertise, you create test plans for highly complex platforms (e.g., validating the interaction of multiple pieces of equipment at the networking and subsystem levels), and using your deep knowledge of component design characteristics, you diagnose highly complex hardware or software issues.

As a Hardware System Validation Engineer, you will be responsible for the overall system validation for Google's consumer hardware products. You have an electrical engineering background and knowledge of multiple low level areas of consumer electronics. You will help define and execute tests for high-speed interfaces, power subsystems, RF circuits, EMC/ESD compliance etc. You'll also work cross-functionally with Circuit Designers, Technology Experts, Contract Manufacturers, and Software, Mechanical and Compliance teams to deliver devices to production.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Only one thing consistently stands in the way between our users and the world's information—hardware. Our Consumer Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Consumer Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
  • Hands-on experience with various lab equipments, such as real-time scope, sampling scope, TDR/TDT, VNA/ENA, spectrum analyzer, impedance analyzer, amp-probes, logic analyzers, protocol analyzers, and etc.
  • Experience with lab validation in one or more of the following areas: high-speed serial interface (MIPI/DP/USB/PCIE), memory interface (DDR/SDR/LPDDR3/LPDDR4), RF validation (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Cellular), Power supply (Switch PS, LDO), EMC/ESD/Safety compliance, Display, Camera (optical and electrical), Audio, input device validation (capacitive touch, keyboard, mice etc.).
  • Experience with modern analog, digital electronic circuits, and transmission line theory.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.
  • Certified LabVIEW Developer (CLD) or Certified LabVIEW Architect (CLA).
  • Experience with the consumer product development process for mass volume production design, with focus on power integrity, signal integrity, and EMC/EMI/ESD.
  • Experience in Simulation and lab correlation in both frequency domain and time domain with commercial tools, such as PowerSI, PowerDC, OptimizePI, SIwave, and/or HSPICE.
  • Experience in software programming for lab automation with Linux environment, Perl, Python, Tcl, MATLAB, and/or C++.
responsibilities:
• Prepare and execute test plans, on the system and sub-system level, to catch issues early, improve the product quality and ensure an excellent user experience with minimum development delays.
  • Collaborate with Design Engineers in system bring up, design validation, troubleshooting, failure analysis, and system performance.
  • Participate by making sound recommendations to resolve issues.
  • Work with Manufacturing Test Engineers and Contract Manufacturers on transitioning products to mass production, and manage product sustaining efforts.
title: Hardware System Validation Engineer, Consumer Products
